description: This course is a study of the physical, social, cognitive, and emotional development of adolescents. Students will build their understanding of both normative and problematic development during adolescence and will learn about issues of special concern to adolescents, their families, and professionals who study or encounter adolescents. Students will leave this class with a thorough understanding of the period of adolescence as well as the ability to identify significant milestones. Students will also be able to think critically about the issues surrounding this developmental stage. Prerequisites: PSYCH 125
